decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to use aggressive tactics to quickly lower your own life total in order to enable the powerful Death's Shadow creature. Through cards like Thoughtseize, Thought Scour, and Inquisition of Kozilek, you can disrupt your opponent's game plan while setting up your own strategy. The deck also includes a strong suite of removal spells like Fatal Push and Terminate to deal with threats from the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Snapcaster Mage and Kolaghan's Command provide additional versatility and value, allowing you to stay ahead in resources and maintain pressure on your opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Dredge mechanic to fill the graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug, in order to bring back powerful creatures like Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast. By using Life from the Loam to repeatedly return crucial lands, and cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion to churn through the deck, the player aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flood of creatures and burn spells like Conflagrate. This deck relies on synergy between its graveyard interactions to quickly assemble a powerful board presence and close out the game.

The deck relies on the synergy between Amulet of Vigor and bounce lands to generate extra mana and cheat out Primeval Titan to search for utility lands to quickly assemble a winning board state. It uses cards like Azusa, Lost but Seeking and Sakura-Tribe Scout to put extra lands into play, while also running cards like Explore and Ancient Stirrings to find key pieces. The deck also includes a couple of backup win conditions like Walking Ballista and Engineered Explosives, as well as Pact of Negation for protection.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay by utilizing a combination of powerful creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. The deck includes a variety of removal spells like Terminate, Fatal Push, and Lightning Bolt to handle threats efficiently. Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek help to disrupt the opponent's game plan by stripping away key cards from their hand. The creatures in the deck, such as Tarmogoyf, Scavenging Ooze, and Dark Confidant, provide strong threats and card advantage to maintain pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively ramp up mana using Urza's lands and Expedition Map to quickly cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. Chalice of the Void and Warping Wail provide disruption for the opponent while Karn Liberated serves as a versatile threat and removal spell. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early threats and powerful creatures, utilizing Eldrazi Temple to reduce the cost of casting Eldrazi creatures. All Is Dust and Dismember provide additional removal options, while Mind Stone and Sea Gate Wreckage offer card advantage and utility.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively disrupt your opponent's hand and control the board with removal spells, while quickly deploying powerful threats like Death's Shadow. This deck aims to use cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to take away key pieces from the opponent's hand, while deploying efficient threats like Gurmag Angler and Tasigur, the Golden Fang. The deck also utilizes cards like Serum Visions and Thought Scour to dig for important cards and maintain card advantage. With a focus on tempo and disruption, this deck aims to close out games quickly with big threats.

The main concept of this deck is to use cards like Mishra's Bauble and Street Wraith to manipulate your life total and control the size of Death's Shadow on the battlefield, allowing you to quickly put pressure on your opponent. With efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Stubborn Denial, along with disruptive cards like Thoughtseize, you can disrupt your opponent's game plan while maintaining a fast and aggressive strategy. The deck also features a small toolbox of versatile spells like Traverse the Ulvenwald to help find key pieces of your strategy when needed.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Search for Tomorrow, Farseek, and Explore, in order to play Scapeshift and trigger Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal a significant amount of damage to the opponent. The deck also includes utility cards like Lightning Bolt, Anger of the Gods, and Engineered Explosives for removal and control. The win condition revolves around resolving Scapeshift and having enough lands, particularly Valakut and Mountains, on the battlefield to deal lethal damage to the opponent in one turn.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's game plan while keeping the pressure up with aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf, Death's Shadow, and Street Wraith. Traverse the Ulvenwald helps find key cards while Mishra's Bauble provides card selection. Liliana of the Veil can help control the board and Dismember, Abrupt Decay, and Tarfire provide removal options. The deck's goal is to quickly reduce the opponent's life total while efficiently managing resources to secure victory.

This deck focuses on playing aggressively by utilizing the Death's Shadow mechanic, where you aim to lower your own life total while also controlling the opponent's board using a combination of removal spells and discard effects. The deck runs a low land count to maximize its threat density, aiming to deploy threats like Tarmogoyf and Death's Shadow early on and finish the game quickly. The inclusion of Mishra's Bauble helps to enable Delirium for Traverse the Ulvenwald while also providing additional card selection. Stubborn Denial serves as both protection for your threats and a way to counter opponent's spells.

The main concept of this deck is to use Collected Company and Chord of Calling to assemble a toolbox of creatures that can combo together to create a powerful board presence. The deck focuses on efficiently ramping with mana dorks like Birds of Paradise and Noble Hierarch, while using cards like Vizier of Remedies and Devoted Druid to generate infinite mana. This allows the deck to play a wide range of powerful creatures like Kitchen Finks and Eternal Witness, while also having access to removal options like Fiend Hunter and Scavenging Ooze for flexibility in different matchups.

This deck focuses on quickly enchanting a hexproof creature with powerful auras, making it nearly impossible for the opponent to remove or block. By building up a large creature with multiple enchantments, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless assault, pushing for a fast victory before the opponent can mount a defense. The key strategy is to protect your hexproof creatures while boosting them with auras to create a formidable threat that is difficult to stop.

This deck focuses on dealing fast, efficient damage to the opponent with a mix of burn spells and aggressive creatures. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent quickly and prevent them from stabilizing by denying lifegain. Cards like Boros Charm and Skullcrack help to disrupt any potential defenses, while cards like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear apply early pressure. The deck aims to win before the opponent has a chance to set up their own game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt opponents by combining aggressive creatures with taxing effects like Leonin Arbiter and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. This strategy aims to slow down opponents' game plan while steadily advancing its own board development with creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Eldrazi Displacer. The inclusion of disruptive creatures like Tidehollow Sculler and Wasteland Strangler adds another layer of disruption, while cards like Aether Vial and Flickerwisp provide additional utility and instant speed interaction. The deck aims to control the game tempo and pressure opponents into making suboptimal plays.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the necessary combo pieces, such as Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer, while using cards like Pyretic Ritual and Desperate Ritual to generate mana. By casting spells like Gifts Ungiven to search for key cards like Grapeshot or Past in Flames, the deck aims to generate a high storm count and deal a large amount of damage to the opponent in a single turn. The deck focuses on efficiency and speed to overwhelm the opponent before they can react.

This deck focuses on using discard spells and cantrips to disrupt the opponent's strategy and dig for key cards. The deck aims to quickly reduce its own life total to make Death's Shadow a powerful threat on the board. Efficient removal spells and counterspells help protect Death's Shadow and other creatures, while also controlling the opponent's board. The deck's synergy between its cards allows it to apply aggressive pressure while staying protected, creating a strong and competitive aggressive strategy in the Modern 1 vs 1 format.
